Headline: Summer 2018 @ the Learning Lab
Text: We are making things together this summer. Follow along!
Chicago by zach.wise

Headline: LL This Week
Text: LL Staff planned for the week and talked through various strategies for documenting the summer%u2019s activities.

Headline: Interview Set Up
Text: Marlon teaches us how to set up for interviews!
Produced: Video, Generated ideas on color cards for introducing key steps to future learners of process/equipment

Headline: Facilitation Team informal mtg
Text: We three gathered for super preliminary discussions of several deliverables that we%u2019ll be aiming to produce over the course of the summer. We also discussed some options for events and gatherings during our Facilitation/Collaboration/Participation-themed weeks.
Produced: Notes for meeting later this week with Amanda and Mara

Headline: Unconscious Reflections_001
Text: Elli led a session of unconscious reflections to kick off our documentation of process in team documentation of process.
Produced: Visual artwork (colored pencil and chalk on black butcher paper) and written artist statements of reflection. Jordan%u2019s can be found inthis folder.

Headline: Code Team Planning
Text: Phil and Lauren started working on the Team Code Manifesto

Headline: Planning Week
Text: LL Staff planned for the week and talked through various strategies for documenting the summer%u2019s activities.

Headline: Workflow redesign pt. 1
Text: The tech team met to discuss summer plans and refine goals. Katie began working to streamline workflows and logins for MPAs.
Produced: Clean calendar and google drive for MPAs at media@learninglab.xyz

Headline: LLUF Activity brainstorm
Text: We brainstormed a structure for Week 0 and Weeks 1-6, as well as activities and tutorials for LLUFs during that time!
Produced: We added all of our plans and ideas to the LL_SUMMER_2018_LLUF_MANUAL doc. Those plans and ideas include possible tutorials for the Code team to work on, a potential example bio for the LLUFs, Week 0 orientation and activity plans, and a theme-based weekly structure for Weeks 1-6, with ideas for different themes and activities.

Headline: Fellow Initial Goals Interviews with Lauren
Text: Lauren interviews Jordan and Elli on what they want to learn over the summer. Elli interviews Lauren on the same.

Headline: Linocut Documentation test
Text: We will test the 20-minute activity Marlon (or sub) will do with Houghton Fellows on Wednesday afternoon. We will learn how to capture artistic processes and products with phone cameras (as this is what the students will be doing), but we will also be using the LL Studio Cameras and screens to help illustrate some elements of visual storytelling that they%u2019ll .

Headline: Studio build
Text: The Summer team reconstructed the Learning Lab studio.

Headline: Medium/Tools/Manuevers Manifesto planning
Text: Working on manifesto together & using Linocut overview as starting point for crafting the "Why" template considering how Why relates to HOW documentation

Headline: Whohfesta Meeting with Marlon
Text: Documentation team met with Marlon to go over our whohfesta and outline our plans (muahahahaha) for the summer.

Headline: Meeting with Sharon Kivenko
Text: Documenation team discussed how to best support Sharon Kivenko with her new TDM course Choreographies of Resistance.

Headline: Documentation Team Planning
Text: Documentation team discussed our whohfesta and what we each hope to accomplish this summer.

Headline: Tech Team Planning
Text: The Tech team met to refine their summer charter and narrow focus down to four projects: 1. Control Room Refinement, 2. Github and Coding, 3. Studio Promotion, and 4. Workflow Optimization.

Headline: Team Engage! initial planning meeting
Text: We started our manifesto and big projects list, began mapping out our week (#2) and questions

Headline: Brainstorm Map Concepts
Text: Started thinking about connecting Mapping as a "Move" to Medium, Object, Courses and Learnign Objectives -ain anticipation of Map Week 1; capruting ideas and creating a Map Plan for our week

Headline: Movement of the Moment Documentation
Text: We documented the movement of the moment as proof of concept for one of our micro docu menu options
Produced: movement of the moment folder for today

Headline: Medium/Tool/Maneuver Team Planning
Text: Team M/T/M met to figure out which week we'll lead over the summer and agreed on Week 1: Maps! We also discussed the overarching schema of resources that we'll produce this summer (a "Why X" document with many other tangential resources, like tools and maneuvers, branching out from that).

Headline: LL Summer team meeting
Text: Everyone got together to go over the calendar for the week. Major topics of conversation included the arrival of summer LLUFs this afternoon, co-creating our summer manual, and reviewing last week's log.

Headline: Team Engage! Planning
Text: Continue to develop the manifesto, projects list, and adding to the 2018 LL Sumer Manual

Headline: Drawing the Unconscious
Text: Welcome all LLGF's, LLUF's and Bok staffers to explore the images of your unconscious through this guided art practice. We will be doing these weekly to document our internal processes as well as making visible the invisible. Come to one or come to all, all are welcome!

Headline: Team Engage Website Tools Meeting
Text: Discussed Mara's plans for the Inclusive Teaching resources on the Bok website. She will continue to revise and develop content with Pauline, while Amanda and Jacob design a way to engage the LLUFS during week 2 in creating video content.

Headline: Exploring Space & Mapping
Text: reviewing draft ideas to contribute to Map week,organize for Space week ; also looked at manifesto, our process

Headline: Graphic Design Tutorial
Text: Learn the basics of graphic design with AIE Alum Vanessa Chung. Open to LLGF and staff

Headline: Map Week
Text: LL Staff planned for the week and talked through various strategies for documenting the summer%u2019s activities.

Headline: Learning Lab Workflow Mapping
Text: The Tech Team gathered to talk through the various digital and personal workflows that make the Learning Lab function.

Headline: Structure Week
Text: LL Staff planned for the week and talked through various strategies for documenting the summer%u2019s activities.

Headline: Breakfast & Launch Meeting
Text: Come here to learn what%u2019s happening this week, to help us make sure we can do it all, and to drink coffee.

Headline: Maps Reading Group and Design Challenge
Text:
We are going to have a brief discussion of the readings and models you can find here.  Then we%u2019ll think about what we can make in response to these readings and models.

Readings:
On Exactitude In Science by Jorge Luis Borges 
Using Process Mapping to Redesign the Student Experience by Bridget Burns and Alexandria Aljets
Excerpt from Religion, Science, and Empire by Peter Gottschalk

Headline: Minding Making Map designLab
Text: Chloe Chapin will give an introduction to Prof. Jennifer Robert%u2019s Minding Making project and her new initiative to create a map of making spaces on campus, then we%u2019ll brainstorm spaces and forms that this map can take.

Headline: Drawing the Unconscious Workshop
Text: Join us for the second installment of this drawing exercise lead by Elli.

Headline: LLUF Test: From Maps to Narratives
Text: When beginning a large project, spatial thinking is often just as valuable as writing as a way to organize and develop one%u2019s ideas.  This just-in-time test is going to help us refine an activity we will be offering the Houghton Fellows the same afternoon, in which they will first use various visual thinking strategies to map out their summer research projects, and then attempt to move from maps to stories.

Headline: Mapping the Learning Lab Hiring Process
Text: Katie redesigned a map of the process for hiring undergraduates.

Headline: Houghton Fellows: From Maps to Narratives
Text: The Houghton Fellows will return to the Learning Lab where they will go through the same activity prototyped by LLUFs in the morning: employing various visual thinking strategies to map out their summer research projects, and then attempting to move from maps to stories.

Headline: Cinema 4D Tutorial
Text: Chris, Marlon, and Mario will lead interested parties through a Cinema 4D tutorial which will prepare us for the activities of the afternoon. Topics will including extruding 3D models in C4D from 2D Illustrator Vectors and populating and manipulating artifacts.

Headline: C4D Studio Mapping
Text: During this working session we can choose between two different paths. One path is to use Cinema 4D to model items in the Learning Lab to add to our growing Learning Lab prop library. A second path is to place premade objects in the Learning Lab model and then animate cameras through the space to create a digital tour.

Headline: Knight Lab designLab
Text: Northwestern University%u2019s Knight Lab has developed a number of mapping tools that help users tell stories over time and space. Join a designLab where we will investigate two Knight Lab tools, Story Map and Timeline.js, and work together to create our own based on the activities of the Learning Lab this summer. Bonus points if you help brainstorm ways to use these tools in classrooms or develop a prompt.

Headline: Learning Lab Workflow Mapping
Text: Marlon, Katie, and Mike will explain the workflows of the Learning Lab, including code (thelocalworkflow), media pipeline, and task workflows. After these presentations, you will be challenged to create visual representations of each.

Headline: Mapping Facilitation
Text:
Jayati Doshi introduced and guided us through the use of the following tools:

Collective sense-making: This is more of a facilitation technique for making sense of complex questions we are sitting with together. The way I facilitate this is to offer opportunities for people to "try on" new ideas as well as ways of challenging each other, and the focus is on perspective taking, while practicing vulnerability and challenge.

Card game: This is more of a "tool", where I use the structure of a card game to encourage people to follow guidelines for tough conversations. This is still in the pilot stage, so while we can definitely demo this, this will be slightly more informal.

Headline: Storyboarding
Text: Use art supplies or digital tools to create a storyboard for a capstone film you plan to create this summer.

Headline: Studio Lighting Map Test
Text: The Studio team will be testing out new maps of studio lighting plans. Let us know if you%u2019re interested!

Headline: Photoshop Drop-In Hours
Text: Bring any questions you have to LLGF Jacob Watson.
